intro: Leucas princei, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are white to pale blue, arranged in a star-like pattern, and bloom during the cooler months. It is often used in traditional medicine and is also cultivated as an ornamental plant.
